question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
How many paths are there from $A$ to $C$, if every step must be up or to the right?[asy]size(4cm,4cm);int w=6;int h=5;int i;pen p=fontsize(9);for (i=0; i<h; ++i){draw((0,i) -- (w-1,i));}for (i=0; i<w; ++i){draw((i, 0)--(i,h-1));}label("A", (0,0), SW, p);label("C", (1,2), NE, p);label("B", (w-1,h-1), NE, p);[/asy]
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{10}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: There is 1 step to the right, and 2 steps up.  These 3 steps can be made in any order, so the answer is $\binom{3}{1} = \boxed{3}$.
